data.text: @aworld2win The organiser was this piece of shit ML, who was grooming for the ML Party. The whole time we spent in that group was reading Stalin's essays. I lasted two meetings before I exploded.

@aworld2win I remember the leftist group I joined while at Carleton. All middle class kids, most of whom either hadn't worked in the summer before uni or had some well paying City or government internship, and me, the only blue collar working person...
@aworld2win Its all performative Red Guards agitprop.
@aworld2win In fairness. They care as much about workers as the oligarchs and kleptocrats do...
@aworld2win I mean. They admit that it happened while also denying it. It's like how the Nazis who on one hand deny the Holocaust and then talk about how they should have finished it.
@toszmn Yeah I have no idea how they figured out eg wtf is happening in Hungary in 1956

@aworld2win I mean, when you have Chomsky unwilling to admit he was wrong about the killing fields in Cambodia for twenty years and then give a half assed apology and gaslighting about having been write about it with the limited information at the time. I think we're fucked.

@aworld2win Yes. Thats true. I think whats interesting is that this entrenched inability to view other documentation and be willing to be proven wrong predates the Internet but the Internet definitely strengthened it.
